revised_title: Flicker and the Effect of Sector Arrangement in Discs
tldr: This article investigates the phenomenon of flicker and how the arrangement of white and black sectors on a rotating disc affects the rate of rotation needed for the flicker to vanish. The author finds that the number of sectors and their arrangement influence the rate of rotation, and that the apparent luminosity of black-and-white discs under the same illumination is the same if the sum of the angles of the white sectors is the same.
